participant_id.Description: Unique BIDS identifier for the participant in this study.

prodromal_1_y.Description: Did places that you know well, such as your bedroom, or other rooms in your home, your classroom or school yard, suddenly seem weird, strange or confusing to you; like not the real world? | 1 = Yes; 0 = No

pps_1_bother_yn.Description: Well known places. Did it bother you? | 1 = Yes; 0 = No

prodromal_1b_y.Description: Well known places. Please CHOOSE THE NUMBER below the appropriate picture that shows us how much that bothered you when it happened. | 1=Not very bothered ; 2=Slightly bothered ; 3=Moderately bothered ; 4=Very much bothered ; 5=Extremely bothered

prodromal_2_y.Description: Did you hear strange sounds that you never noticed before like banging, clicking, hissing, clapping, or ringing in your ears? | 1 = Yes; 0 = No

pps_2_bother_yn.Description: Strange sounds. Did it bother you? | 1 = Yes; 0 = No

prodromal_2b_y.Description: Strange sounds. Please CHOOSE THE NUMBER below the appropriate picture that shows us how much that bothered you when it happened. | 1=Not very bothered ; 2=Slightly bothered ; 3=Moderately bothered ; 4=Very much bothered ; 5=Extremely bothered

prodromal_3_y.Description: Do things that you see appear different from the way they usually do (brighter or duller, larger or smaller, or changed in some other way)? | 0= No; 1= Yes

pps_3_bother_yn.Description: Things looked different. Did it bother you? | 1 = Yes; 0 = No

prodromal_3b_y.Description: Things looked different.Please CHOOSE THE NUMBER below the appropriate picture that shows us how much that bothered you when it happened. | 1=Not very bothered ; 2=Slightly bothered ; 3=Moderately bothered ; 4=Very much bothered ; 5=Extremely bothered

pps_4_bother_yn.Description: Special powers. Did it bother you? | 1 = Yes; 0 = No

pps_y_ss_number.Description: Prodromal Psychosis Scale: Number of Yes Responses Sum: prodromal_1_y, prodromal_2_y, prodromal_3_y, prodromal_4_y, prodromal_5_y, prodromal_6_y, prodromal_7_y, prodromal_8_y,  prodromal_9_y, prodromal_10_y, prodromal_11_y, prodromal_12_y, prodromal_13_y, prodromal_14_y, [prodromal_15_y,  prodromal_16_y, prodromal_17_y], prodromal_18_y, prodromal_19_y], prodromal_20_y], prodromal_21_y;  No minimum number of answers to be valid | Loewy, R. L.,  Pearson, R.,  et al. (2011)  Psychosis risk screening with the Prodromal Questionnaire--brief version (PQ-B).  Schizophr Res 129(1): 42-46.

pps_y_ss_number_nm.Description: Prodromal Psychosis Scale, Number of Yes Responses:  Number Missing Answers

pps_y_ss_number_nt.Description: Prodromal Psychosis Scale, Number of Yes Responses:  Number Total Questions

pps_y_ss_bother_sum.Description: Prodromal Psychosis Scale, Number of Yes Responses to Did it Bother You?  Sum: pps_1_bother_yn, pps_2_bother_yn, pps_3_bother_yn, pps_4_bother_yn, pps_5_bother_yn, pps_6_bother_yn, pps_7_bother_yn, pps_8_bother_yn, pps_9_bother_yn, pps_10_bother_yn, pps_11_bother_yn, pps_12_bother_yn, pps_13_bother_yn, pps_14_bother_yn, pps_15_bother_yn, pps_16_bother_yn, pps_17_bother_yn, pps_18_bother_yn, pps_19_bother_yn, pps_20_bother_yn, pps_21_bother_yn; No minimum number of answers to be valid | Loewy, R. L.,  Pearson, R.,  et al. (2011)  Psychosis risk screening with the Prodromal Questionnaire--brief version (PQ-B).  Schizophr Res 129(1): 42-46.

pps_y_ss_bother_sum_nm.Description: Prodromal Psychosis Scale, Number of Yes Responses  to Did it Bother You?  Number Missing Answers

pps_y_ss_bother_sum_nt.Description: Prodromal Psychosis Scale, Number of Yes Responses  to Did it Bother You?  Number Total Questions

pps_y_ss_bother_n_1.Description: Prodromal Psychosis Scale: Number of No Responses  to Did  it Bother You? Intermediate equation for Severity Score - Raw score of 0 (no) transformed to 1 (yes) and 1 (yes) transformed to 0 (no) sum(pps_1_bother_yn, pps_2_bother_yn, pps_3_bother_yn, pps_4_bother_yn, pps_5_bother_yn, pps_6_bother_yn, pps_7_bother_yn, pps_8_bother_yn, pps_9_bother_yn, pps_10_bother_yn, pps_11_bother_yn, pps_12_bother_yn, pps_13_bother_yn, pps_14_bother_yn, pps_15_bother_yn, pps_16_bother_yn, pps_17_bother_yn, pps_18_bother_yn, pps_19_bother_yn, pps_20_bother_yn, pps_21_bother_yn) No minimum number of answers to be valid

pps_y_ss_bother_n_1_nm.Description: Prodromal Psychosis Scale, Number of No Responses  to Did it Bother You?  Number Missing Answers

pps_y_ss_bother_n_1_nt.Description: Prodromal Psychosis Scale, Number of No Responses  to Did it Bother You?  Number Total Questions

pps_y_ss_severity_score.Description: Prodromal Psychosis: Severity Score Sum: (prodromal_1b_y, prodromal_2b_y, prodromal_3b_y, prodromal_4b_y, prodromal_5b_y, prodromal_6b_y, prodromal_7b_y, prodromal_8b_y, prodromal_9b_y, prodromal_10b_y, prodromal_11b_y, prodromal_12b_y, prodromal_13b_y, prodromal_14b_y, [prodromal_15b_y, prodromal_16b_y, prodromal_17b_y, prodromal_18b_y, prodromal_19b_y, prodromal_20b_y, prodromal_21b_y) + (pps_y_ss_ bother_n_1), If  this score = "",  then score = pps_y_ss_number;  No minimum number of answers to be valid | Loewy, R. L.,  Pearson, R.,  et al. (2011)  Psychosis risk screening with the Prodromal Questionnaire--brief version (PQ-B).  Schizophr Res 129(1): 42-46.  In the Prodromal Psychosis survey, "How much did it bother you?" is typically scored 2 - 6.  In the version used by ABCD,  this item was scored  1 - 5.   Because the "Did it bother you" sum score is equal to the sum of the number of severity scores used in the severity score calculation, we were able to compensate for this scoring difference by adding the "Did it bother you" sum score to the severity score.  After applying this change, the severity scores reported here are comparable to those calculated using the  "How much did it bother you"  2 - 6  scoring range.

pps_y_ss_severity_score_nm.Description: Prodromal Psychosis, Severity Score:  Number Missing Answers

pps_y_ss_severity_score_nt.Description: Prodromal Psychosis, Severity Score:  Number Total Questions

pps_ss_mean_severity.Description:
Prodromal Psychosis: Mean Endorsed Severity Score
PPS severity score/Number of yes response
pps_y_ss_severity_score / pps_y_ss_number
